section.title: Role in the team
section.para: My role in the team was to design class Device, which holds every important property of the network device. I implemented DeviceManager, which ensures basic operations over devices - addition, removal, change and search by various parameters. I also modified file import and am responsible for showing the imported devices in GUI and file export.

section.title: Device
section.para: Class that represents a single device. Constructed via the Builder pattern, which allows some modularity with respect to its optional parameters.

listitem.para: deviceType - Type of the device. See supported device types in the respective documentation.
address - Unique string identifier. Must be in valid MAC address format, ie. 01-02-03-04-aa-bb or 01:02:03:04:aa:bb.
numberOfPorts - maximal number of ports available to the device. Must be non-negative.
arrayOfPorts - List of ports of fixed size (numberOfItems size).

section.para: deviceType, numberOfPorts and name properties can be changed. Changing numberOfPorts shrinks/enlarges current arrayOfPorts; shrinking crops reduntant port connections.
arrayOfPorts is list created as Arrays.toList() to ensure fixed size. This prevents to add or remove any port (and thus change the list size), but allows to get or set any list element.
Two devices are equal if their did and address are equal.

section.title: Device Manager
section.para: Device manager is a class that allows basic operations over devices. Devices can be created, updated and deleted. Using Java 8 streaming API, this class also allows search operations based on various conditions, most important being search by device did and address.
